remarks.format: ## Remarks 控制引發事件排序按鈕按下時前,控制項負責排序作業。The control raises the event when a Sort button is clicked, but before the control handles the sort operation. (排序按鈕是一個按鈕其`CommandName`屬性設定為 「 排序 」。)這可讓您提供事件處理方法，執行自訂的常式，每當發生此事件，例如自訂排序運算式。(A Sort button is a button whose `CommandName` property set to "Sort".) This enables you to provide an event-handling method that performs a custom routine whenever this event occurs, such as customizing the sort expression. A物件傳遞至事件處理方法。A object is passed to the event-handling method. 此物件可讓您指定或決定排序運算式和排序方向控制項。This object enables you to specify or determine the sort expression and sort direction for the control. 若要判斷排序運算式，請使用屬性。To determine the sort expression, use the property. 若要判斷排序方向，請使用屬性。To determine the sort direction, use the property. 您也可以取消排序作業，藉由設定屬性`true`。You can also cancel a sorting operation by setting the property to `true`. 如需 類別之執行個體的初始屬性值清單，請參閱 建構函式。For a list of initial property values for an instance of the class, see the constructor. ## Examples 下列範例示範如何使用来顯示的排序方向與目前排序的資料行物件。The following example shows how to use the object to display the sort direction and the column that is being sorted. remarks.format: ## Remarks 當就會引發事件，您可以使用屬性來指定將用來排序的排序運算式控制項。When the event is raised, you can use the property to specify the sort expression that will be used to sort the control. 排序運算式包含要排序之欄位的名稱。The sort expression contains the name of the field to sort. 您也可以一次排序多個資料行，以程式設計方式將此屬性設定為以逗號分隔清單的欄位名稱。You can also sort multiple columns at a time by programmatically setting this property to a comma-separated list of field names. > [!NOTE] > 根據預設，控制項適用於資料行的完整清單的排序方向。By default, the control applies the sort direction to the complete list of columns. 如此一來，只有最後一個資料行清單中適用於排序方向。As a result, the sort direction applies to only the last column in the list. ## Examples 下列範例示範如何使用来顯示的排序方向，以及要排序的資料行物件。The following example shows how to use the object to display the sort direction and the column being sorted. 這個程式碼範例是針對所提供之較大範例的一部分類別。This code example is part of a larger example provided for the class.
